experience: You and John both know Luke Hohmann, Dale Drew, and 51 others

I am proud to be leading the IT PM and Business Partner/BA team in making Preferred the strongest DME/infusion provider in the country.   * Reporting directly to the CIO, I represent the strategic planning and execution for the IT department.  * My deep past experience with infrastructure and applications development helps me work with my peers, the Directors over those areas, plus our Security Officer, to ensure we are working on the right things and the right times to support our business objectives.* My BA team works with each line of business to know their goals and objectives, then they bring that knowledge back to our team and assist me in maintaining our Three-Year IT Strategic Roadmap.* I work closely with our Corporate Services leaders (Finance, Compliance and HR) to ensure their crucial (and often special) requirements are met.
Director of Enterprise PMO - North America
Now oversee Portfolio Management across the entire US operations, not solely just Professional Services.
Director of PMO / Engagement Delivery Services - North America

Retain all responsibilities from my previous Director of PMO position but have added the following:* Now directly manage all Professional Services Project Managers located in the United States.* Now directly manage the Professional Services Clinical Consulting team in the United States.With the additional responsibilities associated with the staff additions the department name was changed to accurately reflect that my team is no longer just solely focused on project delivery, but rather that plus successful direct consulting as well.

Hired to turn up a world-class professional services portfolio management and reporting organization for Orion Health's North America PSG division, as well as lead a team of skilled, professional Business Analysts.  Also own all project management practice processes, procedures and artifacts.* Directly manage two PMO Coordinators (1 in Scottsdale, 1 in Auckland, New Zealand) and five BA's (5 in Boston, 1 in Santa Monica).*  Rolled out a gated project governance model called Phase Gate, allowing internal Orion stakeholders the ability to vote yes or no at five distinct points during project execution as to whether that project is healthy and profitable enough to continue with execution to plan.* Started ad hoc "Global PMO Council" with my counterparts from EMEA and APAC so we could share best practices, processes, tools and procedures.* Developed the tools, processes and procedures to do named-level resource forecasting and reporting across the entire PSG department for North America.  By end of March, 2016 the same method was rolled out across Orion's EMEA and APAC regions as well.* Launched crucial new reporting initiatives to get portfolio health information into the hands of key decision makers more quickly and efficiently.* Personally facilitate formal meetings to transition newly signed customer engagements from the Sales organization to Professional Services.* Sit on the CIO's Communication and Collaboration Steering Committee, charged with developing a roadmap for all such tools and systems throughout the global organization.* Am a stakeholder member of the executive ERP project team, charged with evaluation of ERP vendors and evaluation of solutions, with the goal of issuing guidance and recommendations directly to the CIO on vendor and tool selections for the global organization.* Delivered several smaller initiatives aimed at improving the quality of the project management service.
Minor studies in Accounting and Finance.
Minor studies in Accounting and Finance.
City of Phoenix Veteran's Day Parade

A group of us from the APS Veterans Employee Network Group volunteered to run the C4 / Route management for the City of Phoenix Veteran's Day Parade.  I took route management so I was responsible for ensuring the entire 4+ mile route for the parade was safe, secure and the parade kept time.  This was my first time volunteering at this event and it was a great way to spend a day off...  making sure our vets get the respect they deserve!

recommendations: Julianna (Juli) Quain Carman
Deputy Director, PMO -  Cybersecurity Operations
September 10, 2015, Julianna (Juli) reported directly to John

Any PMO can be a myriad of political, culture and process tangles for a PM entering a new environment.  John was one of those rare Supervisors (now Directors) that understood the hard and soft skills necessary for a PM to thrive and was always willing to focus in and provide direction with whatever key aspect you might be struggling with that day.  He consistently offered timely and effective direction and was always willing to review a process or protocols if it was negatively affecting with his team or the IT environment as a whole to see if there was a better solution possible for all concerned.  It was always an added bonus that he clearly enjoyed being in the trenches with his team as well and brought a cheerful enthusiasm to each problem we tackled.  I definitely miss his presence in the halls but am thrilled he found such a great position to move onward for.  Great guy.
Julianna (Juli) Quain Carman

Lisa Graul, PMP, MBA
Director of PMO
April 28, 2015, Lisa reported directly to John

John is a born leader. Leadership is a soft skill that has to be fluent to meet each transaction, challenge and opportunity all while interfacing with other humans. Great leaders can be built, mentored and grown given the perfect environment but that takes years and a great deal of energy.  Born leaders effortlessly walk into any situation and have people want to follow them, be near them, and gain advice from that first moment. That is what you have in John Kretz. John’s technical skills speak for themselves and I can say his credentials are not just letters behind his name.  While I had the honor of directly report to John I always knew he would fairly and honestly deal with any situation. He was the forerunner in building policy and procedure as well as refining the regulations that built the IT PMO.  In over 20 years of being a PM in highly regulated arenas I can say John was the best leader I have had the honor of working for.

Connecting Talent with Opportunities @ APS!
February 9, 2017, John worked with Rhonda in different groups

During my time at Orion Health I worked extensively with Rhonda as she worked to fill my employment openings.  Rhonda was a great partner to me, working with me to find better candidates, whether that was strategic such as where to look for people, or tactical like altering wordings in job postings to get better responses.  Rhonda was always thinking about how best to get me the most probable candidates.   Beyond that Rhonda was a great corporate citizen, too.  She really cared about the company culture in our offices and worked with us in leadership to ensure we were bringing in the best people.  I would work with Rhonda again, without question.

summary: I am passionate about IT project management.  As a certified practitioner for more than 20 years I have seen the positive results as strong, mature PMO can bring to an IT department.  The past several years I have taken that passion and transitioned into PMO leadership positions, where I can affect change across a larger platform of mission-critical projects. I know what it takes to build a strong, successful IT Project/Program Management Office:* Talk Return on Investment with executives and senior leaders* Talk Strategic Alignment with Enterprise Architects and Business Leaders* Talk efficiency gains with mid-level management* Find and recruit the best IT project managers and Scrum Masters* Implement measurements, metrics and KPI's to show the performance and value of the IT PMO* Enable continuous improvement through feedback, active listening and Voice of the Customer
name: John Kretz, MBA, PMP, CSM, FBI-DHS InfraGard
title: DECEASED - September 13, 2017
